programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: An examination of what ufology calls 'trace cases', where physical material from a strange encounter is analysed to determine if it is evidence of an alien contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists delve into the stories of people who claim to have mingled with extraterrestrial beings while they were on the brink of death.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: For a Good Time, Call Ivy
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi are under financial pressure, and fear they will lose one of their shops if they do not make a profitable bid soon.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to find people with abilities that would not seem out of place in one of his comics.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives encounter a huge cast of shady characters as they investigate the execution of a millionaire, and soon begin to suspect his murder was a professional hit.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams go in search of cars to strip to a shell with a budget of £250 as they try to make the most money in the scrap metal market.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts assess the possibility that alien invaders could opt to destroy life on Earth rather than attempt to enlighten mankind.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Reported accounts of genuine alien encounters, with specific regard to the so-called flying saucer, which has become synonymous with UFO terror.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos investigates whether aliens lie at the heart of Earth's most famous mysteries. In this instalment, he looks at the new clues narrowing down the possible location of Atlantis, suggesting that Plato's mysterious island was the home of an advanced civilisation.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. Seth rushes to sell the sports memorabilia after spending a fortune at an auction. Meanwhile, Les checks out a Starfire convertible.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth has his eye on a valuable guitar, a customer tries to buy a fancy watch, and Les strikes a deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the security guards start spooking customers, Les sends them home to teach them a lesson.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a major deal with a new supplier for a truckload of TVs, before getting excited about rare Detroit Tigers baseball memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has stainless steel jewellery coming to the shop, but Ashley refuses to sell it - until she is forced to do so by her cousin Karen.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Cousin Karen is ready to shake things up on the showroom floor, but Ashley is less than thrilled to have someone invading her turf.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les takes his niece Karen under his wing to help out at the jewellery counter, Ashley fails to conceal her jealousy well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the guys recall some of their favourite sets of wheels. Reality series following the work of staff at a pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers present a Christmas edition looking back on highlights from the series.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1800s one-horse-open sleigh rides in, but it remains to be seen whether Rick and Corey make an offer on the potentially lucrative item.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Dan and Laura's house for a charity white elephant gift exchange. It might well be for charity, but will the warriors leave their competitive sides at the door?.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: As the tuna begin to migrate south, the crews' jobs become even tougher with just three weeks of the season remaining.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at cases where people have claimed that strange voices have urged them to commit horrific deeds, and an analysis of whether they could have been obeying the orders of aliens.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Thomas grapples grumpily with some awkward hand-wear, Sian Gibson seems to find proof that she may be psychic and Iain Stirling shows some tasty shortbread who's boss.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedy writer and actor Richard Ayoade takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from October 2018, with Conservative MP Nicky Morgan and comedian Jon Richardson joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: A woman searches for a cute new car to purchase, and Elo and Rebecca are on hand to show her a series of their modern and classic car choices.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Sixty teams take on a very quick course down Windhaven Parkway in Fort Worth. Who will triumph in the Lone Star State?.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Top Gear: Winter Blunderland
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May present their best winter challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Africa on a mission to find the definitive source of the Nile, the world's longest river, which spans more than 4,000 miles. The trio believe they can do a better job than explorers who claim to have discovered the waterway's starting point by travelling further and faster than previous efforts - but the only tools at their disposal are determination, ingenuity and three ageing estate cars.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to Norway to find out how a selection of cars fare when taking part in Winter Olympic events. Their experiments include firing a rocket-powered Mini off a ski jump, tackling the biathlon with 4x4s, staging a game of motorised ice hockey and timing the Jaguar XK in a speed-skating race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are challenged to build a bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand. In order to do that, however, they have to drive across Burma, a country that has been largely closed to Westerners for more than 40 years, and must make the trip in three lorries, each bought sight unseen from the internet on a limited budget. What follows is an epic journey of beautiful scenery, regular adversity, ongoing malfunction and the constant bickering of the three men.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the Brazil event, in which teams of amateur racers design and build their own gravity-powered soapbox vehicles and race them in an extreme downhill battle.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and comedians Rhod Gilbert, Rufus Hound and Miranda Hart are the guests on the comedy panel show. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack guide the contestants as they try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by TV presenter Patrick Kielty, actor Bernard Cribbins, Dragons' Den judge Deborah Meaden and comedian Mark Watson on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of three preserved steam railway lines - the South Devon Railway heritage line, the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway and the Great Central Railway. Sports scientist Megan Smith has a dream of becoming a steam locomotive fireman on the Ffestiniog & Welsh Highland Railway, and she fires-up NG143 and sets off along the 25 miles from Caernarfon to Porthmadog.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Hampton Court Palace, which started out life as a Tudor palace in 1515 and is famous for being the home of King Henry VIII.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Schönbrunn Palace in Austria, which is located in a 500-acre park and includes an orangery, palm house and one of Europe's oldest zoos.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: The German army's Blitzkrieg tactics, which led to the swift conquest of Holland, Belgium and France.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: A focus on the Battle of Britain and the Blitz and the Italian troops entering North Africa.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germany's plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: An ex-convict is found murdered in his home and suspicion immediately lands on a recently released child killer. Nikki and the Lyell team are introduced to forensic psychologist Sasha Blackburn, who works closely with those released from prison on licence, as both the victim and one of the suspects are clients of hers. The investigators soon learn that it is not just the minds of these young men that are fragile, but their freedom is too. Feature-length episode of the crime drama, guest starring Lyndsey Marshal and Niamh Cusack.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny is heartbroken when Hugh makes a series of disastrous choices about his marriage and career, while love is in the air on Hayley and Ajax's wedding day.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Dr Hugh Knight's plans to leave Whyhope are scuppered when tragedy strikes, and Penny makes a fateful decision about her love life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A football match is cut short when trouble arises. Elsewhere, Nelson has problems with his girlfriend, and Paddy faces a few home truths.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The day of Major Kieran Voce and Captain Kate Butler's wedding arrives. Meanwhile, Donna Tucker starts to get closer to her tutor.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin arranges for Ric to be reunited with his estranged son, a situation that becomes complicated when it transpires his girlfriend is six months pregnant and hooked on drugs. When she goes into premature labour, it falls to Jess and Zubin to save the baby. Connie leaves Will to handle an emergency heart operation on his own, but Mickie comes to the rescue, displaying surprising surgical skills. Former EastEnders actress Lucy Speed guest stars as a patient expecting quads.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry tracks down the paedophile who abused him as a child and, enraged by the old man's lack of remorse, resorts to physical violence. Yvonne tries to stop pregnant teenager Shirley selling her baby, but her well-meaning intervention has unexpected and potentially tragic consequences. Debbie learns her nanny has been hiding a shocking secret and Phil consoles Samantha, who is now convinced her missing daughter Abi has been abducted.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani fears Terry has taken the law into his own hands when both he and Malcolm Willard go missing, but it seems the aged paedophile has more to fear from Terry's brother Ben, who is also looking for revenge. Irene Radford issues dire threats after her son Wayne is found dead in his cell, apparently from an overdose, while Neil reprimands Andrea for breaking regulations - only to end up in a passionate embrace with her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline and Arthur are still reeling from Mark's revelation, while Michelle and Clyde decide to tackle some unfinished business between them.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark is determined that Michelle shouldn't be let into the family secret, but Pauline has other ideas.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel are eager for Sandy and Harry's return from Canada.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.sub-title: The Sign of the Broken Sword
programme.desc: A murder is committed at the local army barracks using a legendary broken sword, and the incident leads the priest to investigate another death at Dunkirk 13 years previously. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne attends the funeral of local barber Cedrik Verga and shortly after is puzzled to receive a message from beyond the grave - a text from the deceased claiming 'I was murdered'. Given that his phone was in the coffin, is this a sick prank or something altogether more sinister? Humphrey agrees to investigate, and they soon find evidence to rule out his death from natural causes. Meanwhile, Humphrey demonstrates his culinary skills to Florence and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Vicky Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: Gremlins (1984)
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.

programme.title: Party Like It's Christmas!
programme.desc: HITS CHRISTMAS!! we're here to get your xmas party started with some of the best party tracks alongside some great xmasy videos.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of tyres made by the Titan Corporation, espresso coffee and how diamonds are cut.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds an unregistered Cobra sports car that has only 1,000 miles on its clock, but expert mechanic Edd China faces a difficult challenge to get it to pass a tough emissions test.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The host, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Ed Byrne, oversees a clash between The North Euston from Lancashire and The Sportsman from Huddersfield, West Yorkshire.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Footage of not-so-smooth highway drifts that end in epic accidents, and sci-fi cars that offer a glimpse of the strange future of car design.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Including people shedding their clothes and inhibitions on the road, horrible parking that breaks all the rules, and a momentous truck manoeuvre which ends in disaster.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Rain causes a series of spectacular race car crashes, a tornado destroys a town, a freeway collapses, a jet crashes at an air show and a drag boat crashes at 200mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Clips of a fire at a chemical plant, a racing driver trapped in a burning car, a pilot tipped from a hot air balloon during a show, a train derailment and a stunt jump gone awry.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby's machine has been dead in the swamp for days, so he races to get a new engine fitted in time to deliver to the mills and restore his reputation.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team revamps a Chevrolet with a crumpled rear that was bought by a college student two years previously.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Dirt Dogs invest in a hard rock mining plant. The Gold Gypsies are eager to be back in the field, but a $20,000 excavator repair is a tough start to the season.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Scrappers launch their season determined to find a huge gold haul. Meanwhile, new crew the Victoria Diggers may have stumbled on a million-dollar mother lode.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: One team breaks all records, unearthing the biggest gold nugget ever found on television. Neville and Mick are hampered by a run-in with one of the deadliest snakes on the planet.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Gypsies strike a patch of gold, but are distracted when thieves raid their nearby lease. Meanwhile, torrential rain disrupts production for the Dirt Dogs.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Victoria Diggers' million-dollar dream almost reaches breaking-point. The Dirt Dogs hunt down gold thieves and the Mahoneys stumble across a mysterious murder.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: While fighting for survival, the Victoria Diggers stumble upon what may be a monster nugget. The Gold Gypsies fend off deadly snakes during their search.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Gold Gypsies hunt for nuggets in ancient mine shafts and Greg discovers a rare meteorite. The Mahoneys chase for more gold using Ted's grandfather's treasure map.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Mahoneys look for gold in one of the world's most remote regions. Meanwhile, the Victorian Diggers may have stumbled across millions of dollars' worth of gold.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Victoria Diggers might have found a multi-million-dollar load, but they need help extracting it. The Scrappers continue to struggle with broken machines.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Gold Gypsies' tenacity is rewarded with their biggest nugget of the season. Meanwhile, Jake's new plan to save the Dirt Dogs' season turns into a disaster.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Scrappers boss Alex Stead gambles his remaining cash on bigger machinery, pushing his marriage to the edge. And, the Victoria Diggers unearth a rare artefact.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Dirt Dogs' huge dry blower shuts down due to extreme temperatures, while the Mahoneys and Gold Gypsies take a last-minute gamble that delivers big gold.

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Neville and Mick end the season set to deliver another monster nugget. Plus, Scrappers boss Alex pays the ultimate price for gambling his life savings.

programme.title: World's Deepest Goldmine
programme.desc: South Africa's Mponeng mine reaches 3,500km into the ground, but its gold reserves are almost exhausted. This documentary questions whether the risks posed to the underground workers justify burying even deeper into the Earth.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Holland where, thanks to its thriving antiques markets, he can find the kind of unique pieces he's renowned for - including his dream car, a vintage Bugatti.

programme.title: When Dinosaurs Roamed
programme.desc: How newly discovered fossils found in America have provided scientists with evidence of previously unknown species and helped fill a 30-million-year gap in the continent's prehistory. State-of-the-art computer technology takes viewerd back to a time when the prehistoric giants were the kings of land, air and sea.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacturing process of Berettas and cotton, and an insight into the complexity of the Paris sewer system.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How tunnels are built and the secret of the lion dance. Plus, a device that removes rain water from sports fields, allowing play to resume faster.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Giant Man & Tiny Wife: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man who is over seven feet tall and his wife, who is under five feet, discuss their difficulty conceiving. Plus, the story of a woman who often falls asleep for up to a month.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 43-year-old Pennsylvania DJ Ervin Holton, who in November 2012 was shot dead on his friend's porch. With no witnesses, police turned to security cameras located opposite for clues.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators who use minute scraps of evidence to discover the full story behind a murder and solve serious crimes.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A series of robberies in Detroit caused panic in 1994, but when one homeowner got the chance to fire a shot at the intruders, detectives gained a vital clue to their identities.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Rescue driver Andre Folks is confronted by four angry pit bulls while trying to execute a night-time drugs raid.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer and her picky entourage return to the shop for a second look, while a bride clashes with her mother over her choice of a non-traditional gown.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A woman identifies a dead body as her missing sister Annie - but Annie is still alive.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic examiners can expose a killer's deadly intentions when murder victims are lured to their deaths by acquaintances.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man risks everything in the hunt for his sister's killer, and a sexual predator is getting away with his crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators search in abandoned cars and shallow graves to unearth vital pieces of evidence that criminals believe are safely hidden.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on Sean, who four years since he started his weight loss journey is set back again by the death of his mother. He then ends up in hospital again after a bad fall.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Updates on Liz, Jennifer and Marissa. Despite now being able to walk, old fears still hang over Liz. Jennifer and Marissa still cannot get along, especially when Jennifer takes back her ex.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After three years and five surgeries, Milla is one of Dr Now's most successful patients ever. However, she needs to continue pushing through the pain to reach her final goal.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs helps a former Marine to locate his birth mother. A woman calls on Lisa Joyner to help find her brother, following the tragic death of their father from Aids.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Janine's extreme obesity has left her nearly immobile, meaning she must overcome both her physical and emotional pain if she's ever going to live a normal life again..

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: It is a busy time for dermatologist Dr Sandra Lee as she treats patients looking to fix their skin issues ahead of the festive season.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Deadly Face Tumour: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man with a facial tumour needs one more operation, but may not be able to face the procedure after a near-death experience.
